definition[0]: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult
example[0]: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
example[1]: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
example[2]: Explorers penetrated deep into unknown regions.
definition[1]: to start to sell things to an area or country, or to have an influence there
example[3]: Few U.S. companies have successfully penetrated the Japanese electronics market.
definition[2]: to succeed in becoming accepted into a group or an organization, sometimes in order to find out their secrets
example[4]: KGB agents had penetrated most of their intelligence services.
example[5]: Science has penetrated the mysteries of nature.
example[6]: What could I say that would penetrate his thick skull?
definition[5]: if a man penetrates someone, he puts his penis into a woman’s vagina or into someone’s anus when having sex
definition[6]: to see into or through something when this is difficult
example[7]: My eyes couldn’t penetrate the gloom.
definition[7]: if a company penetrates a new market or area, it starts selling goods or services in that market or area
example[8]: The company has been struggling to penetrate the US market.
